g.text: START
input
Half Light: Do you feel that?
You: There's nothing suspicious here. [Discard thought.]
You: I said I'm *really* not interested in stupid conspiracy theories. [Discard thought.]
You: "I'm sorry I doubted you even for a moment, Kim." (Lie.)
Kim Kitsuragi: "At least you were forthcoming with your doubt. Now, let's move on. I find this subject tiresome."
You: Feel what?
You: "I'm really just interested in the spy tech. How did you get the micro-cassettes so micro?"
You: What, where? (Look around.)
Kim Kitsuragi: "I respect you as a colleague, and so I will have this conversation with you, but only once."
Kim Kitsuragi: "Now, let's move on. I find this subject tiresome."
Half Light: *Don't* you, though?
Logic: Assume for the sake of argument that there's something to this inane conspiracy... If Seol is keeping tabs on everyone, maybe they can fill in some of your memory holes...
Kim Kitsuragi: "There is no Seolite Conspiracy, and even if there were, I would not be a part of it."
You: "Why not?"
Kim Kitsuragi: "I don't care what that delinquent said."
You: "I knew it! I knew you couldn't really be a traitor!"
Kim Kitsuragi: He gestures for you to stop.
Half Light: There, *the lieutenant*. Isn't it suspicious how he's always there, *watching* you, *listening* to you?
You: "I'm sorry I doubted you, Kim."
You: "I just want to know what's in my personal file. Who am I? What happened to me? You owe me that much, at least."
Kim Kitsuragi: The lieutenant sighs, takes off his glasses, and breathes on the lenses, fogging up the glass. As he wipes them clean on his jacket, he begins speaking.

Kim Kitsuragi: "I was born and raised Revacholian. So was my mother. As for my father, I didn't know him, I don't know who he was. And I don't care. From what I've heard, he wasn't a very pleasant person to be around."

"As you've heard me say before, I was born and raised Revacholian. So was my mother. As for my father -- I didn't know him, I don't know who he was. And I don't care. From what I've heard, he wasn't a very pleasant person to be around."
Empathy: Isn't that what you've always wanted, to be listened to?
You: Nope, everything's normal here. [Discard thought.]
You: I don't feel anything.
You: "Thanks for clearing that up, lieutenant."
Kim Kitsuragi: He smirks. "Nothing from surreptitious recordings collected by Seolite agents in an effort to compromise the Militia."
You: "But Gary said..."
You: Okay, maybe there's *something*. (Look around.)
Kim Kitsuragi: "And no such recordings exist, to my knowledge. Seol has bigger squid to fry."
Kim Kitsuragi: "Yes. Now, let's move on. I find this subject tiresome."
You: "Wait, so you can't tell me anything about myself, using spy technology?"
Kim Kitsuragi: He leans back and studies you with a look of grave concern.
Kim Kitsuragi: "In case you've forgotten, men and women in our profession rarely make it to retirement -- and certainly not if they do not trust their partners."
Half Light: That tingle on the back of your neck... like you're being *watched*.
You: "Kim, is it true that your people are secretly spying on everyone?"
Kim Kitsuragi: "My... people? What are you talking about?"
You: "You don't need to pretend anymore, Agent Kim. I know all about your Seolite spy tech."
Kim Kitsuragi: The lieutenant is waiting patiently, tapping his foot lightly to a tune only he can hear.
